meanings.definition: Love of life or living systems.
meanings.sent1: Her biophilia was evident in the way she cared for every plant in her garden.
meanings.sent2: Many people feel a strong biophilia when they are surrounded by nature.
meanings.sent3: His biophilia was so extreme that he even named his pet rock 'Rocky'.
meanings.sent4: The artist's biophilia shone through in her vibrant paintings of flowers and animals.
meanings.sent5: The child's biophilia was so pure and innocent, it was as if he could communicate with the birds.

meanings.definition: A hypothetical human tendency to interact or be closely associated with other forms of life in nature.
meanings.sent1: The concept of biophilia suggests that humans have an innate connection to nature.
meanings.sent2: Biophilia can be seen in the way people enjoy spending time in parks and forests.
meanings.sent3: The biophilia of the city dwellers was put to the test when they went camping for the first time.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, his biophilia was like a magnetic force drawing him to the wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's biophilia guided him through the dense jungle, feeling at home among the trees.
